content:
• Wednesday, March 14, 2012
  • RUE

    More on Rue21 (NASDAQ:RUE) Q4 comes in mixed, beating on a per share basis but coming up short...

    More on Rue21 (NASDAQ:RUE) Q4 comes in mixed, beating on a per share basis but coming up short on revenue. Earnings actually rose 19% Y/Y, as the teen-apparel retailer posted better margins and sales, but revenue growth and same-store sales still missed the company's expectations. Shares -5.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • ORCC

    More on Online Resources (NASDAQ:ORCC): Q4 beats across the board on record sales growth....

    More on Online Resources (NASDAQ:ORCC): Q4 beats across the board on record sales growth. Revenue grew slightly Y/Y, as the company's the changes to its long term growth plan gather steam. The company also ups guidance, now expecting an EPS of $0.05 - $0.06 per share and revenue of $41.2M - $41.7M. The Street is at $0.03 per share in earnings and revenue of $40M. Shares +21% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM
  • TWER

    Broadband services provider Towerstream (NASDAQ:TWER) +21.1% AH after reporting Q4 revenues...

    Broadband services provider Towerstream (NASDAQ:TWER) +21.1% AH after reporting Q4 revenues increased 6% Y/Y to $7.2M, and adjusted earnings rose to $1.3M vs. $700K in the year-ago period. Revenues for Q1 are expected at $7.6M-$7.7M, with adjusted earnings of $1.2M-$1.4M.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:32 PM
  • PCG

    PG&E (NYSE:PCG) -2.2% AH after announcing a 5.9M share, $250M stock offering. The utility...

    PG&E (NYSE:PCG) -2.2% AH after announcing a 5.9M share, $250M stock offering. The utility says it will use the proceeds for general corporate purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM
  • GES

    More on Guess?'s (NYSE:GES) FQ4: North American same-store sales fell 5%, worse than FQ3's 4%...

    More on Guess?'s (NYSE:GES) FQ4: North American same-store sales fell 5%, worse than FQ3's 4% drop. North American retail revenue +1% Y/Y, Europe -1%, Asia +27% (but only 9% of total). Guess? expects FQ1 revenue of $560M-$575M and EPS of $0.25-$0.28, below a consensus of $609.7M and $0.48, and FY13 revenue of $2.74B-$2.78B and EPS of $2.50-$2.65, below a consensus of $2.83B and $3.18. GES -11.4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM
  • WAVX

    Encryption software vendor Wave Systems (NASDAQ:WAVX), which was due to report earnings today,...

    Encryption software vendor Wave Systems (NASDAQ:WAVX), which was due to report earnings today, says it's postponing its Q4 release after determining "there are certain accounting errors" in the 2009-2011 financial statements of recently-acquired subsidiary Safend. Wave also expects to request a 15-day extension for the filing of its 2011 10-K. Shares are halted.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • SU

    Suncor Energy (SU -4.1%) finished sharply lower a day after reporting one of two upgraders at...

    Suncor Energy (SU -4.1%) finished sharply lower a day after reporting one of two upgraders at its oil sands facility will be taken offline for three to five weeks for unplanned maintenance.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • EGLE

    Eagle Bulk Shipping (NASDAQ:EGLE): Q4 EPS of -$0.03 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $70M (-3.3% Y/Y)...

    Eagle Bulk Shipping (NASDAQ:EGLE): Q4 EPS of -$0.03 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $70M (-3.3% Y/Y) beats by $3.3M. Shares +1.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • IPAR

    Pilgrim's Pride (IPAR -2.8%) closes lower after being downgraded to Equal Weight on valuation at...

    Pilgrim's Pride (IPAR -2.8%) closes lower after being downgraded to Equal Weight on valuation at Stephens, citing a lack of catalysts following the company's Q4 results.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • LINU-OLD

    Asia Entertainment & Resources (AERL): Q4 EPS of $0.38 may not be comparable to consensus of...

    Asia Entertainment & Resources (AERL): Q4 EPS of $0.38 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.52. Revenue of $69M (+62% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +4.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • ORCC

    Online Resources (NASDAQ:ORCC): Q4 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $38.7M (+2.4% Y/Y)...

    Online Resources (NASDAQ:ORCC): Q4 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $38.7M (+2.4% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +18.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • NABI

    Nabi Biopharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:NABI): Q4 EPS of -$0.05 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $0.8M (-79%...

    Nabi Biopharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:NABI): Q4 EPS of -$0.05 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $0.8M (-79% Y/Y). Shares +1.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • PAG

    Penske Automotive (PAG +2.8%) finishes the day higher after Sterne Agee raised its 2012...

    Penske Automotive (PAG +2.8%) finishes the day higher after Sterne Agee raised its 2012 estimates earlier, citing recent acquisitions, a lower share count and continued improvement in U.S. demand. The firm maintains its Buy rating.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • GES

    Guess? (NYSE:GES): Q4 EPS of $1.05 in-line. Revenue of $776M (+2.5% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -12.7%...

    Guess? (NYSE:GES): Q4 EPS of $1.05 in-line. Revenue of $776M (+2.5% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -12.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • STI

    Oppenheimer says SunTrust (STI +4.5%) is still attractive following Fed's rejection of its...

    Oppenheimer says SunTrust (STI +4.5%) is still attractive following Fed's rejection of its capital plan, noting it was surprised by the rejection and fully expects the company to resubmit. The firm thinks that the market is underestimating the company's cost-cutting initiatives, and it maintains an Outperform rating on the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • KOPN

    Needham cuts its rating for Kopin (KOPN -5.8%), a supplier of semiconductor products and...

    Needham cuts its rating for Kopin (KOPN -5.8%), a supplier of semiconductor products and microdisplays for mobile applications, to Hold from Buy and forecasts a $0.01 EPS loss in 2012 vs. a prior $0.26 gain. KOPN's military segment is being hurt by Defense Department budget cuts, the firm says, forcing the company to forecast weak guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • DELL

    EMC (EMC -1.7%) dips after being downgraded to Buy from Conviction Buy at Goldman, citing recent...

    EMC (EMC -1.7%) dips after being downgraded to Buy from Conviction Buy at Goldman, citing recent share performance. The stock has been a powerhouse lately, gaining over 40% since early January.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • PNK

    Pinnacle Entertainment (PNK -4.6%) slides on rival Ameristar Casinos' (ASCA +3%) plans to buy a...

    Pinnacle Entertainment (PNK -4.6%) slides on rival Ameristar Casinos' (ASCA +3%) plans to buy a gaming license for a proposed luxury resort in Lake Charles, La., ensuring stiff competition in PNK's key Louisiana market. "The problem for PNK is that this new and now larger casino will be a competitor to PNK's existing property in Louisiana," an FBR analyst says.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • PRU

    Prudential (PRU -2.4%) shares slide alongside MetLife (MET -5.8%), even though PRU wasn't part...

    Prudential (PRU -2.4%) shares slide alongside MetLife (MET -5.8%), even though PRU wasn't part of the Fed's stress test. But insurance industry experts think both insurers may be named "systemically important financial institutions" when the category is finalized by the Financial Stability Oversight Council. If so, both would be subject to some level of Fed scrutiny.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM
  • NXP

    NXP Semiconductors (NXP +3.5%) gains after being upgraded to Conviction Buy at Goldman earlier...

    NXP Semiconductors (NXP +3.5%) gains after being upgraded to Conviction Buy at Goldman earlier today. The firm cites the company's gross margin expansion, positive mix shift and greater earnings leverage than peers, among other reasons.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM
  • RLD

    RealD (RLD +3.7%) trades higher after being upgraded to Buy from Neutral on valuation at Dougherty.

    RealD (RLD +3.7%) trades higher after being upgraded to Buy from Neutral on valuation at Dougherty.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • HMNY

    Helios & Matheson (HMNY +107%) shares more than double on at least 20x their average daily...

    Helios & Matheson (HMNY +107%) shares more than double on at least 20x their average daily volume after the business software company posts a surprise profit for FY 2011.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • MSG

    Shares of Madison Square Garden (MSG -2.1%) trade lower as a report tips off that the coach of...

    Shares of Madison Square Garden (MSG -2.1%) trade lower as a report tips off that the coach of the New York Knicks is set to resign. The reaction of MSG's share price may be tied closer to the waning of the Linsanity phenomenon that was pumping out extra revenue for the company than who is actually coaching the team.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM | 2 Comments
  • FSS

    Federal Signal (FSS +22.3%) soars after its Q4 results easily topped Street estimates this...

    Federal Signal (FSS +22.3%) soars after its Q4 results easily topped Street estimates this morning. Orders jumped 87% Y/Y, led by improvements in order rates at the manufacturing company's environmental solutions and federal signal technologies groups.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM
  • AAPL

    Another day, another new high for Apple (AAPL +3%); the world's biggest fruit company is now...

    Another day, another new high for Apple (AAPL +3%); the world's biggest fruit company is now worth $545B, nearly twice as much as Microsoft. In addition to Morgan Stanley's note, shares are getting a boost from Canaccord's Mike Walkley, who reports shipping wait times for the new iPad have risen to 2-3 weeks. Walkley now expects Apple to sell 65.6M iPads this year, and 90.6M next year. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM | 2 Comments
  • EA

    Electronic Arts (EA -3.3%) sells off as concerns mount about slow sales (I, II) for major new...

    Electronic Arts (EA -3.3%) sells off as concerns mount about slow sales (I, II) for major new releases, such as Star Wars: The Old Republic and snowboarding game SSX - the latter is at #129 on Amazon's video games bestseller list, and has received a $20 price cut from GameStop. Meanwhile, Take-Two Interactive (TTWO -2%) is down after Sterne Agee claims Grand Theft Auto V likely won't be available for the holiday season.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • STT

    State Street (STT +1.9%) follows ups its passing stress grade with a 33% increase in the bank's...

    State Street (STT +1.9%) follows ups its passing stress grade with a 33% increase in the bank's dividend payout to $0.24 a share and a new stock repurchase program of $1.8B.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM
  • AUO

    AU Optronics (AUO -5.9%) dives after being convicted, along with 2 former execs and a U.S....

    AU Optronics (AUO -5.9%) dives after being convicted, along with 2 former execs and a U.S. subsidiary, of taking part in an "LCD price-fixing conspiracy that lasted for five years." As a result, AU faces a fine as large as $1B - that figure easily dwarfs the hefty fines paid by other LCD panel makers for their involvement in the scheme.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM
  • JNPR

    Juniper (JNPR -2.7%) dips after BMO Capital cut the shares to Market Perform. BMO says the...

    Juniper (JNPR -2.7%) dips after BMO Capital cut the shares to Market Perform. BMO says the company's recovery is taking longer than expected, it's under-performing its peers in routers and network security and new product uptake remains uncertain.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM
  • TLT

    Treasury prices get no relief from a reasonable auction of 30-year paper, the long bond still...

    Treasury prices get no relief from a reasonable auction of 30-year paper, the long bond still down nearly 2 full points, and the yield 10.5 bps higher at 3.38%. The 10-year note is off a point and a quarter, the yield up 10 bps to 2.24%. TLT -2.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM | 8 Comments
  • BBBY

    Bed Bath & Beyond (BBBY +4.1%) moves up after its comp estimates are raised at Bernstein to...

    Bed Bath & Beyond (BBBY +4.1%) moves up after its comp estimates are raised at Bernstein to 4.6% from 3.3%. Baird cites the company's improvement in discrete comp drivers and improving sales trends. The company rates the shares at Outperform with an $80 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM
  • RBCN

    Shares of Rubicon Technology (RBCN +12.2%) race higher, helped along with a bullish call from...

    Shares of Rubicon Technology (RBCN +12.2%) race higher, helped along with a bullish call from Avian. Analysts with the firm line up a lofty $20 price target on RBCN, calling it one of the "best longs" in the LED space.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • COF

    Capital One (COF +3.8%) says delinquencies and charge-offs at its U.S. credit-card business fell...

    Capital One (COF +3.8%) says delinquencies and charge-offs at its U.S. credit-card business fell in February. The company saw 30-day delinquencies decline to 3.62% last month from 3.78% in January, while charge-offs decreased to 3.84% in February from 4.08% a month earlier. Separately, Capital One passed the Fed's stress tests and did not ask for a dividend increase or share buyback.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • MRVL

    Nomura keeps a cautious tone with its analysis on Marvell (MRVL -1.9%), maintaining a Reduce...

    Nomura keeps a cautious tone with its analysis on Marvell (MRVL -1.9%), maintaining a Reduce rating and $13 price target. Analyst Romit Shah says that the read-through from LSI's guidance boost doesn't point to higher PC demand and finds the long-term margin profile troubling.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • BEAM

    A top exec at Beam (BEAM +1.1%) says the company is considering more price increases as...

    A top exec at Beam (BEAM +1.1%) says the company is considering more price increases as opportunities present themselves. North America President Bill Newlands says bourbon brands such as Jim Beam, Maker's Mark, and Knob Creek are all in the line of fire for price hikes, while competitive pressure in the vodka market will make it trickier to raise prices on its vodka products. Shares of BEAM trade at an all-time high as M&A chatter still percolates.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX -2.8%) is upgraded to Buy at S&P Capital IQ, which expects NFLX to...

    Netflix (NFLX -2.8%) is upgraded to Buy at S&P Capital IQ, which expects NFLX to "sustain global market share gains on exponential global growth of streaming video consumption." S&P says unique subscribers should grow to 33M by year-end 2012 and 37M by 2013. But today, shares add to losses from news of Wal-Mart's disc-to-digital service.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM | 3 Comments
  • GE

    General Electric (GE +1.2%) shares climb as the Fed’s bank stress tests boost confidence...

    General Electric (GE +1.2%) shares climb as the Fed’s bank stress tests boost confidence that its finance unit can resume a payout this year. Some banks are increasing buybacks and dividends to 70% or more of 2012 profit forecasts, so GE's plan to resume taking a payment of 40%-50% of GECapital's earnings isn’t “an aggressive bar to clear."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM
  • INTC

    Altera (ALTR +2.1%) moves up after Goldman Sachs adds shares to its Conviction List, citing...

    Altera (ALTR +2.1%) moves up after Goldman Sachs adds shares to its Conviction List, citing "strong fundamental drivers through 2012." Programmable logic devices, which ALTR makes, have been 18% below “normalized levels” of late for the entire industry, Goldman says, and ALTR could win market share as 40-nanometer parts displace older 150-nanometer parts.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • PSUN

    Pacific Sunwear (PSUN -14.4%) CEO Gary Schoenfield says in an earnings CC that the company...

    Pacific Sunwear (PSUN -14.4%) CEO Gary Schoenfield says in an earnings CC that the company expects to stay on pace to close 110 stores in FY12 after it shut down 119 during FY11. He also notes that the firm has brought on P-E firm Golden Gate Capital as an adviser. (Previous: earnings)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • FXF

    Swiss parliament rejects calls for stricter oversight of the SNB following massive currency...

    Swiss parliament rejects calls for stricter oversight of the SNB following massive currency market interventions and the recent scandal that caused the departure of its President. The franc dives as this seemingly gives a green light for the bank to continue its policy of weakening the currency. FXF -0.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • ECYT

    Endocyte (ECYT +37.4%) shares skyrocket after the biopharma company says it will submit...

    Endocyte (ECYT +37.4%) shares skyrocket after the biopharma company says it will submit conditional marketing authorization applications for its EC145 and EC20 ovarian cancer treatments in Europe after meeting with EU health authorities.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • STI

    SunTrust (STI +2.8%) fell short in the Fed's stress test, but shares swing to a gain as...

    SunTrust (STI +2.8%) fell short in the Fed's stress test, but shares swing to a gain as investors focus on the last sentence of the bank's press release: "SunTrust's improved earnings momentum has continued in the first quarter of 2012 and is expected to result in earnings per share that exceed the first quarter First Call mean estimate."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • CARB

    Carbonite (CARB +4.1%) gets a boost from positive comments out of Canaccord this morning, saying...

    Carbonite (CARB +4.1%) gets a boost from positive comments out of Canaccord this morning, saying the sell-off has been overdone and the Street is likely to start defending the stock now that the research restriction is off. The firm adds that Carbonite is one of the fastest growing SaaS companies in the space, has a new advertising campaign underway and its competitive dynamics are misunderstood.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 1 Comment
  • OMER

    Biopharmaceutical researcher Omeros (OMER +1.6%) moves up after being upgraded to Buy at...

    Biopharmaceutical researcher Omeros (OMER +1.6%) moves up after being upgraded to Buy at Canaccord earlier this morning, citing impressive efficacy data from its OMS302 Phase 3 trial. The firm also raises its price target to $13 from $5.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • C

    Citigroup's (C -3.2%) stress test failure may not be such a big fail as headlines suggest, some...

    Citigroup's (C -3.2%) stress test failure may not be such a big fail as headlines suggest, some analysts say. DealBreaker's Matt Levine says it isn’t a failure of Citi’s current balance sheet, it’s a failure of the capital plans submitted to the Fed. Nomura notes Citi’s minimum stressed T1Cratio was a healthy 5.9% before proposed capital actions, vs. 5.7% forBAC and 6.3% for JPM.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM | 2 Comments
  • MET

    Wells Fargo says MetLife (MET -4.5%) is likely to continue trading with a negative bias over the...

    Wells Fargo says MetLife (MET -4.5%) is likely to continue trading with a negative bias over the near term, after its stress test fell short of several measures that were not foreseen by the company nor the market. However, Wells believes the insurer is also working diligently to exit the banking business and maintains its Outperform rating on the stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM | 1 Comment
  • BTH

    Blyth (BTH +14.4%) trades higher after reporting Q4 revenue of $365M, well-ahead of the...

    Blyth (BTH +14.4%) trades higher after reporting Q4 revenue of $365M, well-ahead of the consensus estimate of analysts that called for $296.9M. The company says that sales of its ViSalus weight-loss products soared 627% Y/Y to $96.7M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • RAD

    Rite Aid (RAD +6.4%) shares surge as Credit Suisse suggests a Walgreen (WAG) acquisition of the...

    Rite Aid (RAD +6.4%) shares surge as Credit Suisse suggests a Walgreen (WAG) acquisition of the drugstore chain would make sense strategically given its contact dispute with Express Scripts and CVS and reimbursement rate pressures. Putting the odds of a deal at one in three, the firm says it would create significant synergies and not likely to raise major antitrust concerns.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM | 1 Comment
  • BA

    Shares of Boeing (BA +1.1%) bounce a bit higher after a VP tips off at an aviation conference...

    Shares of Boeing (BA +1.1%) bounce a bit higher after a VP tips off at an aviation conference that the company expects to announce new 747-8 orders in the coming months.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • SCLN

    SciClone Pharmaceuticals (SCLN +30.7%) posted better-than-expected Q4 results, helped by a...

    SciClone Pharmaceuticals (SCLN +30.7%) posted better-than-expected Q4 results, helped by a widened product portfolio boosted by its NovaMed acquisition and growth in sales of its key drug Zadaxin, and raised its 2012 forecast to EPS of $0.72-$0.78 on revenue of $165M-$170M vs. estimates of $0.43 on revenue of $168M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR +4.7%) trades higher after agreeing to a 5-year deal to supply Leap Wireless'...

    Clearwire (CLWR +4.7%) trades higher after agreeing to a 5-year deal to supply Leap Wireless' Cricket brand (LEAP -0.7) with LTE network services. Cricket aims to deploy LTE across a bulk of its current network over the next two to three years.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM
  • JCP

    Deutsche Bank clips the wings of J.C. Penney (JCP -2.3%), flying ever since a two-day Ron...

    Deutsche Bank clips the wings of J.C. Penney (JCP -2.3%), flying ever since a two-day Ron Johnson-apalooza stoked investor interest that the retailer could reinvent itself. Analyst Charles Grom says that so far Johnson's strategy has led to customer confusion and lower traffic, instead of turbo-charging sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • ASCA

    Ameristar Casinos (ASCA +14%) soars after announcing it will spend $32.5M to acquire Creative...

    Ameristar Casinos (ASCA +14%) soars after announcing it will spend $32.5M to acquire Creative Casinos, developer of a planned luxury resort in Lake Charles, LA called Mojito Pointe. Ameristar says it will invest at least $500M in building the resort, and expects to open it in mid-2014.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • LHCG

    P-E firm TPG Capital is considering making an offer for LHC Group (LHCG +3.8%),...

    P-E firm TPGCapital is considering making an offer for LHCGroup (LHCG +3.8%), Reuters reports, as the provider of home health and hospice services reviews its strategic alternatives. LHCG has been hit by a series of setbacks, including reimbursement cuts, federal investigations into billing practices and new Medicare regulations.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • FRAN

    Shares of Francesca's Holdings (NASDAQ:FRAN) soar 16.2% higher off of its Q4 earnings beat and...

    Shares of Francesca's Holdings (NASDAQ:FRAN) soar 16.2% higher off of its Q4 earnings beat and boost to FY12 guidance. The optimism is tied to the ongoing pick up in shoppers the women's specialty retailer is seeing even after the holiday season.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM | 1 Comment
  • NORW

    The krone plunges against the euro after Norway's central bank unleashes a surprise by cutting...

    The krone plunges against the euro after Norway's central bank unleashes a surprise by cutting its benchmark rate 25 bps to 1.50%. "The continuing downturn abroad and the strong krone are contributing to keeping inflation low and weighing on growth in Norway," says Norges Bank Governor Olsen. NORW +16.6% YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:40 AM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +1.6%) rises after Starbucks (SBUX +0.5%) states at a UBS conference...

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +1.6%) rises after Starbucks (SBUX +0.5%) states at a UBS conference (webcast) it will sell Green Mountain's Keurig brewer and K-Cups in stores later this year, in spite of its release of the Verismo. Starbucks also reiterates its goal of having 1,500 stores in China by 2015, and says it sees coffee costs, which have pressured margins, dropping in 2H. (slides - .pdf)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:34 AM
  • PMCS

    PMC-Sierra (NASDAQ:PMCS) +2.7% premarket after its board raises the amount of stock authorized...

    PMC-Sierra (NASDAQ:PMCS) +2.7% premarket after its board raises the amount of stock authorized for repurchases to $315M, comprising a new buyback program for up to $275M in common stock on top of an existing $40M authorization. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • CCI

    Wireless tower owner Crown Castle (NYSE:CCI) celebrates its coming move into the S&P 500,...

    Wireless tower owner Crown Castle (NYSE:CCI) celebrates its coming move into the S&P 500, but it's getting no respect today as shares are downgraded to Neutral at Goldman Sachs and J.P. Morgan on a valuation basis following the stock’s recent strong performance. CCI -2.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG) announces that it will merge with privately-held Innovate/Protect in a stock swap...

    Vringo (VRNG) announces that it will merge with privately-held Innovate/Protect in a stock swap deal. In addition, the company names Andrew Perlman as its CEO to replace Jonathan Medved. Shares of VRNG +18.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM
  • LSI-OLD

    LSI (NASDAQ:LSI-OLD) +4% premarket after raising its current quarter guidance thanks to...

    LSI (NASDAQ:LSI-OLD) +4% premarket after raising its current quarter guidance thanks to increased demand for hard disk drives and flash-based products. The chipmaker now expects adjusted EPS between $0.12-$0.16 on revenue of $585M-$615M, vs. prior guidance of $0.09-$0.15 on revenue of $550M-$590M.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM
  • ES-OLD

    EnergySolutions (NYSE:ES-OLD): Q4 EPS of $1.08 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.11....

    EnergySolutions (NYSE:ES-OLD): Q4 EPS of $1.08 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.11. Revenue of $468.5M (+4.1% Y/Y) beats by $43M. Shares +9% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:46 AM
  • MU

    Shares of Micron Technology (NASDAQ:MU) stir up a tidy 1.9% gain premarket after the company...

    Shares of Micron Technology (NASDAQ:MU) stir up a tidy 1.9% gain premarket after the company catches an upgrade from Bernstein to Outperform from Market Perform. The Street is decidedly bullish on Micron with only one lonely analyst out of the 27 covering the stock daring to come in with a Sell rating.
